subject: Colleges and Universities
Basketball
lead_paragraph: The Texas freshman Gary Johnson, sidelined this season because of an unspecified heart condition, can play his first game Jan. 2 against Texas Christian.Johnson was “cleared to participate in all physical activity at the University of Texas,” the trainer Fred Burnett said in a statement Saturday.Johnson, a 6-foot-7 forward who was the Longhorns’ top recruit, has been monitored for the past six months by Dr. James Willerson, president-elect of the Texas Heart Institute and president of the university’s Health Science Center in Houston. University officials released no other details on his condition, which was diagnosed in May.Texas (11-2) lost to Wisconsin, 67-66, on Saturday.
